title: MINOR: Example style improvements
body: These are minor, but no reason to make our example code look worse than it has to.

title: KAFKA-3233: expose consumer per-topic metrics
body:
In version of 0.8.2.1, the old consumer will provide the metrics reporter per-topic consumer metrics under group 'ConsumerTopicMetrics'. For example:

*.ConsumerTopicMetrics.clientId.[topic name].BytesPerSec.count
*.ConsumerTopicMetrics.clientId.[topic name].MessagesPerSec.count

These consumer metrics are useful since it helps us monitor consumer rate for each topic. But the new consumer(0.9.0.0) doesn't expose per topic metrics anymore, even though I did find sensor objects in consumer metrics object collecting per-topic metrics.

After investigation, I found that these sensors are not registering any KafkaMetrics.

title: MINOR: Remove usage of deprecated junit.framework.Assert
MINOR: Update streams RocksDb to 4.1.0
body: This is the latest version in Maven even though HISTORY.md includes releases all the way to 4.5.0.

title: KAFKA-3237 - Remove test cases testInvalidDefaultRange() and testInva…
body: Remove test cases testInvalidDefaultRange() and testInvalidDefaultString(). Defaults if not overridden will get checked on parse. Testing the defaults is unnecessary. This allows you to set that a parameter is required while setting a validator for that parameter. Added a test case testNullDefaultWithValidator that allows a null default with a validator for certain strings.

KAFKA-2832: Add a consumer config option to exclude internal topics
body:
A new consumer config option 'exclude.internal.topics' was added to allow excluding internal topics when wildcards are used to specify consumers.
The new option takes a boolean value, with a default 'false' value (i.e. no exclusion).

This patch is co-authored with @rajinisivaram.

title: KAFKA-3007: implement max.poll.records (KIP-41)
KAFKA-2802: kafka streams system tests
KAFKA-3236: Honor Producer Configuration "block.on.buffer.full"
body:
In Kafka-0.9, `max.block.ms` is used to control how long the following methods will block.

`KafkaProducer.send()` when
- Buffer is full
- Metadata is unavailable

`KafkaProducer.partitionsFor()` when
- Metadata is unavailable

However when `block.on.buffer.full` is set to false, `max.block.ms` is in effect whenever a buffer is requested/allocated from the Producer BufferPool. Instead it should throw a BufferExhaustedException without waiting for `max.block.ms`

This is particulary useful if a producer application does not wish to block at all on `KafkaProducer.send()`. We avoid waiting on `KafkaProducer.send()` when metadata is unavailable by invoking `send()` only if the producer instance has fetched the metadata for the topic in a different thread using the same producer instance. However `max.block.ms` is still required to specify a timeout for bootstrapping the metadata fetch.

We should resolve this limitation by decoupling `max.block.ms` and `block.on.buffer.full`.
- `max.block.ms` will be used exclusively for fetching metadata when `block.on.buffer.full = false` (in pure non-blocking mode )
- `max.block.ms` will be applicable to both fetching metadata as well as buffer allocation when `block.on.buffer.full = true`

title: HOTFIX: release resources on abrupt termination of stream threads
body: Currently the resources, such as the state dir locks, are not release when a stream thread is abruptly terminated. `KakfaStreams.close()` does not release them for the failed threads.

title: KAFKA-3242: minor rename / logging change to Controller
body: KAFKA-3242: minor rename / logging change to references to 'adding partitions' to indicate 'modifying partitions'

title: KAFKA-3243: Fix Kafka basic ops documentation for Mirror maker, black…
body: …list is not supported for new consumers

title: KAFKA-3176: Add partition/offset options to the new consumer
body:
With this pull request the new console consumer can be provided with optional --partition and --offset arguments so only messages from a particular partition and starting from a particular offset are consumed.

The following rules are also implemented to avoid invalid combinations of arguments:
- If --partition or --offset is provided --new-consumer has to be provided too.
- If --partition is provided --topic has to be provided too.
- If --offset is provided --partition has to be provided too.
- --offset and --from-beginning cannot be used at the same time.

This patch is co-authored with @rajinisivaram.

Specifically for 0.9 branch:

title: KAFKA-3225: Method commit() of class SourceTask never invoked
body:
1. Added a test case to prove commit() on SourceTask was not being called.
2. Added commitSourceTask() which logs potential exceptions.
3. Added after call to finishSuccessfulFlush().

title: MINOR: Reconcile differences in .bat & .sh start scripts
body:
A few minor fixes to reconcile differences between the windows and unix versions of the kafka/zookeeper start scripts that were causing cross-platform inconsistencies during deployment.
- Resolve differences in CLASSPATH setup between .bat and .sh start scripts
- .bat start scripts honor externally provided KAFKA_HEAP_OPTS and KAFKA_LOG4J_OPTS consistent with .sh
- .bat start scripts configure log4j similar to .sh

title: KAFKA-3234; Clarify minISR in documentation and auto-generate topic configuration docs
body: Fix design doc comments to clarify minISR and unclean leader election, switch topic configuration doc to be auto-generated.

title: MINOR: remove streams config params from producer/consumer configs
body: Removing streams' specific config params from producer/consumer configs to reduce warning messages.

title: KAFKA-3233: expose per topic consumer metrics to metrics reporter
body:
In version of 0.8.2.1, the old consumer will provide the metrics reporter per-topic consumer metrics under group 'ConsumerTopicMetrics'. For example:

*.ConsumerTopicMetrics.clientId.[topic name].BytesPerSec.count
*.ConsumerTopicMetrics.clientId.[topic name].MessagesPerSec.count

These consumer metrics are useful since it helps us monitor consumer rate for each topic. But the new consumer(0.9.0.0) doesn't expose per topic metrics anymore, even though I did find sensor objects in consumer metrics object collecting per-topic metrics.

After investigation, I found that these sensors are not registering any KafkaMetrics.

title: KAFKA-3229 ensure that root statestore is registered with ProcessorStateManager
body: Pass through the root StateStore in the init method so the inner StateStore can register that object.

title: KAFKA-3227; Conservative update of Kafka dependencies
body:
Patch version bumps for bouncy castle, minikdc, snappy, slf4j, scalatest and powermock. Notable fixes:
- Snappy: fixes a resource leak
- Bouncy castle: security fixes

Also update Gradle to 2.11 (where the notable change is improved IDE integration) and the grgit build dependency.

body: …der to maintain order

title: MINOR: add retry to state dir locking
body: There is a possibility that the state directory locking fails when another stream thread is taking long to close all tasks. Simple retries should alleviate the problem.

title: KAFKA-3219: Fix long topic name validation
body:
This fixes an issue with long topic names by considering, during topic
validation, the '-' and the partition id that is appended to the log
folder created for each topic partition.

body:
There are multi-byte characters In quickstart.html and security.html.
This PR will fix it.

body: …user authorization before modifying acls.

title: MINOR: add setUncaughtExceptionHandler to KafkaStreams
HOTFIX: poll even when all partitions are paused. handle concurrent cleanup
body:
- We need to poll periodically even when all partitions are paused in order to respond to a possible rebalance promptly.
- There is a race condition when two (or more) threads try to clean up the same state directory. One of the thread fails with FileNotFoundException. Thus the new code simply catches it and ignore.

title: KAFKA-3187: Make kafka-acls.sh help messages more generic.
HOTFIX: open window segments in order, add segment id check in getSegment
body:
- During window store initialization, we have to open segments in the segment id order and update `currentSegmentId`, otherwise cleanup won't work.
- `getSegment()` should not create a segment and clean up old segments if the segment id is greater than `currentSegmentId`. Segment maintenance should be driven not by query but only by data insertion.

title: MINOR: Stabilize transient replication test failures in 0.9.0
body:
- ported timeout values in `produce_consume_validate.py` from trunk to 0.9.0
- ported `producer_throughput_value` in `replication_test.py` from trunk to 0.9.0
- fixed `min.insync.replicas` config, which due to an error, was not getting applied to its intended topics

title: HOTFIX: fix NPE after standby task reassignment
body: Buffered records of change logs must be cleared upon reassignment of standby tasks.

title: KAFKA-3218: Use static classloading for default config classes
body: Static classloading is better for default classes used in config to ensure that the classes can be loaded in any environment (OSGi, JEE etc. which rely on different classloading strategies).

title: HOTFIX: RecordCollector should send a record to the specified partition
body: @guozhangwang

title: HOTFIX: open window segments on init
body:
@guozhangwang 

A window store should open all existing segments. This is important for segment cleanup, and it also ensures that the first fetch() call returns the hits, the values in the search range. (previously, it missed the hits in fetch() immediately after initialization).

title: MINOR: Use explicit type in AclCommand
body: Inference sometimes fails for this case.

body: The range is inclusive according to KeyValueStore's java doc.

title: KAFKA-3217: Close producers in unit tests
body: Producers that are not closed auto-create topics in subsequent tests when Kafka server port is reused. Added missing close().

title: KAFKA-3216: "Modifying topics" section incorrectly says you can't change replication factor.
body: Correct the text that said that you can't change the replication factor of a topic.

title: KAFKA-3190 Producer should not fire callback in Send() method
body: @guozhangwang Would you mind take a look? This was originally introduced in KAFKA-1260. I did not find specific reason in the original rb that we have to handle ApiException separately in callback.

body:
This discrepancy was causing a few system tests which to some version validation to fail consistently on 0.9.0 branch. Namely:

```
Module: kafkatest.sanity_checks.test_verifiable_producer
Class:  TestVerifiableProducer
Method: test_simple_run
Arguments:
{
  "producer_version": "0.8.2.2"
}

Module: kafkatest.sanity_checks.test_verifiable_producer
Class:  TestVerifiableProducer
Method: test_simple_run
Arguments:
{
  "producer_version": "trunk"
}

Module: kafkatest.sanity_checks.test_kafka_version
Class:  KafkaVersionTest
Method: test_multi_version
```

- fixed ConcurrentModificationException in StreamThread

KAFKA-3199: LoginManager should allow using an existing Subject
body:
One possible solution which doesn't require a new configuration parameter:
But it assumes that if there is already a Subject you want to use its existing credentials, and not login from another keytab specified by kafka_client_jaas.conf.

Because this makes the jaas.conf no longer required, a missing KafkaClient context is no longer an error, but merely a warning.

The >= should be < since we are actually able to renew if the renewTill time is later than the current ticket expiration.

title: KAFKA-3197 Fix producer sending records out of order
body: This patch reuse max.in.flight.request.per.connection. When it equals to one, we take it as user wants order protection. The current approach is make sure there is only one batch per partition on the fly.

title: KAFKA-3195; Transient test failure in OffsetCheckpointTest.testReadWrite
KAFKA-3162: Added producer and consumer interceptors
body:
This is the most of the KIP-42: Producer and consumer interceptor. (Except exposing CRC and record sizes to the interceptor, which is coming as a separate PR; tracked by KAFKA-3196).

This PR includes:
1. Add ProducerInterceptor interface and call its callbacks from appropriate places in Kafka Producer.
2. Add ConsumerInterceptor interface and call its callbacks from appropriate places in Kafka Consumer.
3. Add unit tests for interceptor changes
4. Add integration test for both mutable consumer and producer interceptors.

title: MINOR: some more Javadocs

body:
Pin kafka system tests to a newer version of ducktape.

Ran in branch builder; only one preexisting (transient) failure:
http://confluent-kafka-branch-builder-system-test-results.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/2016-02-01--001.1454333721--confluentinc--increment-ducktape-dependency--a40f474/report.html

title: KAFKA-3194: Validate security.inter.broker.protocol against the adver…
body: …tised.listeners protocols

title: KAFKA-3191: Improve offset committing JavaDoc in KafkaConsumer
body: Added an example clarifying the correct way to use explicit offsets with commitSync().

title: MINOR: fix the logic of RocksDBWindowStore using RocksDBStore Segments
MINOR: Improve error message for inconsistent broker ids
body: Provides a more actionable and descriptive error message.

title: KAFKA-3175 : Topic not accessible after deletion even when delete.topic.enable is disabled
body: Remove topics under /admin/delete_topics path in zk if deleteTopic is disabled. The topic should never be enqueued for deletion.

title: MINOR: Reorder StreamThread shutdown sequence
body: We need to close producer first before closing tasks to make sure all messages are acked and hence checkpoint offsets are updated before closing tasks and their state. It was re-ordered mistakenly before.

title: MINOR: some javadocs for kstream public api
body: @guozhangwang

title: MINOR: removed obsolete class
body: @guozhangwang

title: KAFKA-3179 Fix seek on compressed messages
body:
The fix itself is simple. 

Some explanation on unit tests. Currently we the vast majority of unit test is running with uncompressed messages.  I was initially thinking about run all the tests using compressed messages. But it seems uncompressed messages are necessary in a many test cases because we need the bytes sent and appended to the log to be predictable. In most of other cases, it does not matter whether the message is compressed or not, and compression will slow down the unit test. So I just added one method in the BaseConsumerTest to send compressed messages whenever we need it.

title: KAFKA-3174: Change Crc32 to use java.util.zip.CRC32
